result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Victim's Petition for Bond Modification, filed by victim. olg    Per SJN on 10/24/2022 - Bond already modified at 10/11/2022 hearing.
Defendants Motion for Pretrial Order. Filed by Atty. Firkus. kma   to rg
Defendant's. Filed by Atty. Firkus. kma   to rg
Defendants Request for Jury Instructions. Filed by Atty. Firkus. kma   to rg
Proposed. Filed by Atty. Firkus. kma   to rg

BOND ON FILE. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Abigail S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:45 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Troy James Majorowicz in court.  Attorney Dan Firkus in court for Troy James Majorowicz. Court reviews file. Atty. Firkus states there is not a resolution, requests one-day trial. Court sets JT and FPT, notes settlement deadline. Atty. Firkus requests bond modification regarding no contact provision. ADA Ellenwood responds. Court modifies bond. Adjourned: 1:52 PM. kma
Jury trial scheduled for February 28, 2023 at 08:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA's Office. km

BOND ON FILE. 

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Abigail S. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:26 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood and Intern Ali Casey in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Jeremiah James Harrelson in court for today for Troy James Majorowicz. Defendant Troy James Majorowicz in court. DE does not qualify for public defender, PFAC provided. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. State requests bond. Court sets bond. Court sets STC for attorney status, SETC and PSC. Adjourned: 2:29 PM. kma
